title: Torsion pendulum - disk alpha at half of theta-max

content.question: A torsion pendulum consists of a vertical wire connected to a uniform disk of mass <math alttext="m sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub></math>, radius <math alttext="r sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub></math>, and rotational inertia <math alttext="one half m sub D, end sub, r sub D, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mi>r</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, as shown in the figure.
